text: The voiceless bilabial stop is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is . The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by "p" as in pear and paper. == Features == == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning Adyghe /paio 'hat' Arabic Algerian /pāpīš 'beautiful girls' Hejazi /pōl 'Paul' Egyptian /kabš 'ram' Armenian Eastern /papik 'grandpa' Assyrian ܦܬܐ 'face' Basque 'to catch' Bengali Eastern পানি/panī 'water' Catalan 'fear' Chinese Cantonese / 'explosion' Chinese Mandarin / bàozhà Chuvash путене/putene [put̬ʲɛ'nɛ] 'quail' Czech 'dog' Danish Standard 'book' Dutch English pack 'pack' Esperanto 'time' Filipino 'duck' Finnish 'grandpa' French 'apple' German 'pile' Greek 'leg' Gujarati /pag 'foot' Hebrew /pakid 'clerk' Hindustani Urdu پل/pal 'moment' Hindi / pal Hungarian 'pope' Italian 'dad' Japanese / 'mailbox' Kabardian /pė 'nose' Khmer / 'to explain' Korean 'light' Kurdish Northern 'hair' Central /píroze 'lammergeier' Southern /pûûnga 'pennyroyal' Lakota púza 'dry' Lithuanian pastatas [ˈpaːstɐtɐs] 'building' Luxembourgish 'cheap' Macedonian пее/pee 'sing' Malay panas 'hot' Maltese 'appetite' Marathi /paa'uus/pā'ūs 'rain' Mutsun 'a sore' Nepali /pitā 'father' Norwegian 'dad' Odia /pathara 'stone' Pashto /pa'nir 'cheese' Persian پول/pul 'money' Pirahã 'otter' Polish 'belt' Portuguese 'father' Punjabi Punjabi ਪੱਤਾ/pattaa/pattā 'leaf' Romanian 'step' Russian /plod 'fruit' Serbo- Croatian / 'drink' Slovak 'dog' Spanish 'weight' Swahili pombe 'beer' Swedish 'monkey' Thai / [pɛ̂ːŋ] 'powder' Tsez пу/pu 'side' Turkish 'pot' Ukrainian /pavuk 'spider' Vietnamese 'tweezers' Welsh siop [ʃɔp] 'shop' West Frisian 'pan' Yi / 'exchange' Central Alaskan Yup'ik 'daughter' Zapotec Tilquiapan pan 'bread' ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Category:Consonants
title: Voiceless bilabial plosive
